com.sadakatsu.clue.cards

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sadakatsu.clue.cards.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    The Hand is a collection of Cards. It is primarily intended to be used as a class for a Match to deliver a Player its hand at the start of the game.
    Author:
    Joseph A. Craig

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand(java.util.Collection<? extends Card> cards)
      Instantiates a new Hand holding the passed Cards.

      Determines whether this Hand does not have the passed Card in it.

      Determines whether the passed Object is a Collection of Cards that contains the same Cards in this Hand (no more and no less).

      Returns a String that lists this Hand's Cards' Abbreviations separated by spaces.

      Returns an unmodifiable Collection of the Cards in this Hand.

        Returns:

      • getDisproveCards

        public java.util.Collection<Card> getDisproveCards(Suggestion suggestion)
        Returns the Cards that are in both this Hand and in the Suggestion. These are the Cards that this Hand's Player could use to disprove the Suggestion.
        Parameters:
        suggestion - The Suggestion in question.
        Returns:
        A Collection of the Cards that are in both the Hand and the Suggestion. This Collection may be empty.

      • getAbbreviation

        public java.lang.String getAbbreviation()
        Returns a String that lists this Hand's Cards' Abbreviations separated by spaces.
        Returns:
        A String formatted as described above.

      • getDistributionString

        public java.lang.String getDistributionString()
        Returns a String describing how many of each Card type are contained in this Hand. The order is Suspect count, Weapon count, and Room count. Each of these numbers is separated by a comma. For example, a return value of "1,2,0" means that this Hand holds one Suspect, two Weapons, and zero Rooms.
        Returns:
        A String describing this Hand's Card distribution.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a user-friendly description of the Cards in this Hand.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
